mng: to fish with a hook and bait

exm.mng: to fish with a hook and bait
Diaoyu or Senkaku Islands between Taiwan and Okinawa (administered by Japan), also known as the Pinnacle Islands
Senkaku Islands (administered by Japan as part of Okinawa prefecture), Diaoyu Islands, Pinnacle Islands
to fish (with line and hook), to dupe
lit. sitting at ease in a fishing boat despite storms (idiom); to stay calm during tense situation, a cool head in a crisis
use a long line to catch a big fish (idiom); a long-term plan for major returns
exm.pyn: fàng cháng xiàn diào dà yú

exm.mng: Jiang Ziya is fishing, if you want take the hook (idiom, refers to early sage 薑子牙|姜子牙 fishing with no bait and the hook above the water); to put one's head in the noose
exm.pyn: tài gōng diào yú , yuàn zhě shàng gōu

exm.mng: Jiang Ziya is fishing, if you want it, take the hook (idiom, refers to early sage 薑子牙|姜子牙 fishing with no bait and the hook above the water); to put one's head in the noose
exm.pyn: Jiāng tài gōng diào yú , yuàn zhě shàng gōu

exm.cur: 任凭风浪起，稳坐钓鱼台
exm.trd: 任憑風浪起，穩坐釣魚臺
exm.mng: lit. sitting at ease in a fishing boat despite wind and storm (idiom); to stay calm during tense situation, a cool head in a crisis
exm.pyn: rèn píng fēng làng qǐ , wěn zuò diào yú tái
